intro: Notelaea longifolia var. pedicellaris, commonly known as the long-stemmed notelaea, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, elongated inflorescences. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It is typically found in coastal or rocky habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
